texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: My synergy setup at work is relatively simple. I have a MacBook Pro running Snow Leopard that acts as a synergy server and a desktop running Fedora 12 as a synergy client. On the Mac, I use SynergyKM to manage the synergy server. The Fedora box uses  my gdm strategy  for starting synergy at the login screen and in GNOME.
texts.text: My synergy setup at work is relatively simple. I have a MacBook Pro running Snow Leopard that acts as a synergy server and a desktop running Fedora 12 as a synergy client. On the Mac, I use SynergyKM to manage the synergy server. The Fedora box uses  my gdm strategy  for starting synergy at the login screen and in GNOME.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I kept having an issue where the shift key would become stuck regardless of the settings I set for the client or server. The
texts.text: I kept having an issue where the shift key would become stuck regardless of the settings I set for the client or server. The

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: configuration option  had no effect. After installing
texts.text: configuration option  had no effect. After installing

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: , I found that both shift keys were getting stuck if I brought the mouse back and forth between Mac and Fedora twice.
texts.text: , I found that both shift keys were getting stuck if I brought the mouse back and forth between Mac and Fedora twice.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I decided to run a test. I started the client with the debug argument and moved the mouse to my Fedora box. At that point, I pressed the letter 'a' and saw:
texts.text: I decided to run a test. I started the client with the debug argument and moved the mouse to my Fedora box. At that point, I pressed the letter 'a' and saw:

texts.orig: I found the keys that corresponded with the key numbers:
texts.text: I found the keys that corresponded with the key numbers:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If I tapped the left shift, I could clear the key press, but I couldn't clear the right shift key (it was stuck down according to Fedora's X server). When I hooked up a physical keyboard and mouse, I was able to use them normally without any keybinding problems.
texts.text: If I tapped the left shift, I could clear the key press, but I couldn't clear the right shift key (it was stuck down according to Fedora's X server). When I hooked up a physical keyboard and mouse, I was able to use them normally without any keybinding problems.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The root cause:  When synergy started in
texts.text: The root cause:  When synergy started in

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: after the gdm login, the keyboard layout wasn't set up properly. The X server was setting up the keyboard layout later in the startup process and this confusion caused the shift keys to get stuck. Fedora 12 uses evdev to probe for keyboards during X's startup and eventually settles on a default layout if none are explicitly defined.
texts.text: after the gdm login, the keyboard layout wasn't set up properly. The X server was setting up the keyboard layout later in the startup process and this confusion caused the shift keys to get stuck. Fedora 12 uses evdev to probe for keyboards during X's startup and eventually settles on a default layout if none are explicitly defined.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The fix:  I added the synergy startup to the GNOME startup items and it works flawlessly.
texts.text: The fix:  I added the synergy startup to the GNOME startup items and it works flawlessly.
